parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate.  The event is a discussion on social media and violence, not related to any specific candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, promoting an event open to the public.  The reach estimate (10K-50K) further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote an event discussing social media and violence. There is no indication that the event aims to influence voting patterns in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The event description suggests a journalistic or academic approach to the topic, aiming to inform and discuss a relevant social issue. The speakers' profiles (journalist and criminology lecturer) further support this.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions related to the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1752439102189695</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes an event discussing social media and violence. The event is not related to the parliamentary elections, nor does it advocate for or against any candidate. The speakers are a journalist and a criminology lecturer, suggesting an informative and academic approach rather than electoral propaganda. The post does not meet the criteria of Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, as it does not directly refer to a candidate, its objective is not electoral, and it does not exceed the limits of journalistic information.  The post's content is consistent with allowed forms of communication.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>MCC</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
